net.nemerosa.ontrack.git

Interface GitRepositoryClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GitRepositoryClientImpl

    public interface GitRepositoryClient
    Defines a client for a Git repository.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • test

        void test()
        Tests the connection
        Throws:
        BaseException - When the remote Git repository is not reachable

      • sync

        void sync(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.String> logger)
        Makes sure the repository is synchronised with its remote location.
        Parameters:
        logger - Used to log messages during the synchronisation

      • isCompatible

        boolean isCompatible(GitRepository repository)
        Checks if the given repository is compatible with this client. The remote, user name and password must be checked.

      • log

        java.util.stream.Stream<GitCommit> log(java.lang.String from,
                                       java.lang.String to)
        Gets a Git log between two boundaries.
        Parameters:
        from - Commitish string
        to - Commitish string
        Returns:
        Stream of commits

      • graph

        GitLog graph(java.lang.String from,
             java.lang.String to)
        Gets a graph Git log between two boundaries.
        Parameters:
        from - Commitish string
        to - Commitish string
        Returns:
        Git log

      • scanCommits

        boolean scanCommits(java.lang.String branch,
                    java.util.function.Predicate<org.eclipse.jgit.revwalk.RevCommit> scanFunction)
        Scans the whole history.
        Parameters:
        branch - Branch to follow
        scanFunction - Function that scans the commits. Returns true if the scan must not go on, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if at least one call to scanFunction has returned true.

      • getBranchRef

        java.lang.String getBranchRef(java.lang.String branch)
        Gets the reference string for a branch given with its local name.

      • getTagsWhichContainCommit

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getTagsWhichContainCommit(java.lang.String gitCommitId)
        Gets the earliest commit that contains the commit.

        Uses the git tag --contains command to get all tags that contains the given gitCommitId.

        Note: returned tags are not ordered.

      • getRemoteBranches

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRemoteBranches()
        Gets the list of remote branches, as defined under ref/heads.

      • diff

        GitDiff diff(java.lang.String from,
             java.lang.String to)
        Difference between two commit-ish boundaries

      • getCommitFor

        java.util.Optional<GitCommit> getCommitFor(java.lang.String id)
        Looks for a commit using its hash

      • getTags

        java.util.Collection<GitTag> getTags()
        List of all tags

      • isCommit

        boolean isCommit(java.lang.String commitish)
        Checks if the commitish string can be parsed into this repository
        Parameters:
        commitish - Commitish string
        Returns:
        true if this is a valid commit-like entry, false otherwise

      • unifiedDiff

        java.lang.String unifiedDiff(java.lang.String from,
                             java.lang.String to,
                             java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String> pathFilter)
        Gets the unified diff between two boundaries, for a given list of paths
        Parameters:
        from - Commitish from
        to - Commitish to
        pathFilter - Filter on the path
        Returns:
        Unified diff

      • download

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> download(java.lang.String branch,
                                              java.lang.String path)
        Downloads a document

      • getSynchronisationStatus

        GitSynchronisationStatus getSynchronisationStatus()
        Gets the synchronisation status

      • getBranches

        GitBranchesInfo getBranches()
        Gets the list of all local branches, and their last commit. If the repository is not synched, or is currently being synched, the map is returned empty.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the repository. Performs even if there is a synchronisation going on.
